Function Documentation

int command_report (  int  argc,
int  last_arg,
char **  argv
) 
 

Parses command-line for report command and performs report functionality.

Parameters:
argc Number of arguments in report command-line.
last_arg Index of last parsed argument from list.
argv Arguments passed to report command to parse.
Returns:
Returns 0 is report is successful; otherwise, returns -1.
Performs report command functionality.

void report_gather_instance_stats (  mod_inst *  root  ) 
 

Parameters:
root Pointer to root of instance tree to search.
Recursively parses instance tree, creating statistic structures for each of the instances in the tree. Calculates summary coverage information for children nodes first and parent nodes after. In this way, the parent nodes will have the accumulated information from themselves and all of their children.

void report_gather_module_stats (  mod_link *  head  ) 
 

Parameters:
head Pointer to head of module list to search.
Traverses module list, creating statistic structures for each of the modules in the tree, and calculates summary coverage information.

void report_generate (  FILE *  ofile  ) 
 

Parameters:
ofile Pointer to output stream to display report information to.
Generates a coverage report based on the options specified on the command line to the specified output stream.

bool report_parse_args (  int  argc,
int  last_arg,
char **  argv
) 
 

Parameters:
argc Number of arguments in argument list argv.
last_arg Index of last parsed argument from list.
argv Argument list passed to this program.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if parsing was successful; otherwise, returns FALSE.
Parses the argument list for options. If a legal option is found for the report command, the appropriate action is taken for that option. If an option is found that is not allowed, an error message is reported to the user and the program terminates immediately.

void report_parse_metrics (  char *  metrics  ) 
 

Parameters:
metrics Specified metrics to calculate coverage for.
Parses the specified string containing the metrics to test. If a legal metric character is found, its corresponding flag is set to TRUE. If a character is found that does not correspond to a metric, an error message is flagged to the user (a warning).

void report_print_header (  FILE *  ofile  ) 
 

Parameters:
ofile Pointer to output stream to display report information to.
Generates generic report header for all reports.

void report_usage (   ) 
 

Displays usage information about the report command.

Variable Documentation

char* input_db = NULL
 

Name of input CDD file to read for generating coverage report. This value must be specified to a value other than NULL for the report phase to complete properly.

mod_inst* instance_root (   ) 
 

Pointer to root of module instance tree

mod_link* mod_head (   ) 
 

Pointer to head element of module list

char* output_file = NULL
 

Name of output file to write report contents to. If output_file is NULL, the report will be written to standard output.

unsigned int report_comb_depth = REPORT_SUMMARY
 

If set to a non-zero value, causes Covered to only generate combinational logic report information for depths up to the number specified.

bool report_combination = TRUE
 

If set to a boolean value of TRUE, reports the combinational logic coverage for the specified database file; otherwise, omits combinational logic coverage from the report output.

bool report_covered = FALSE
 

If set to a boolean value of TRUE, displays covered logic for a particular CDD file. By default, Covered will display uncovered logic. Must be used in conjunction with the -v (verbose output) option.

bool report_fsm = FALSE
 

If set to a boolean value of TRUE, reports the finite state machine coverage for the specified database file; otherwise, omits finite state machine coverage from the report output.

bool report_instance = FALSE
 

If set to a boolean value of TRUE, provides a coverage information for individual module instances. If set to a value of FALSE, reports coverage information on a module basis, merging results from all instances of same module.

bool report_line = TRUE
 

If set to a boolean value of TRUE, reports the line coverage for the specified database file; otherwise, omits line coverage from the report output.

bool report_toggle = TRUE
 

If set to a boolean value of TRUE, reports the toggle coverage for the specified database file; otherwise, omits toggle coverage from the report output.

char user_msg[USER_MSG_LENGTH] (   ) 
 

Holds some output that will be displayed via the print_output command. This is created globally so that memory does not need to be reallocated for each function that wishes to use it.
